posts.name: Rufus Mainwaring
posts.cooked:
So, we want to use NEO 550s on our intake this year, and also intended on using a gearbox. We would love to use MAXPlanetary, but we have a ton of Versa so it makes sense for us to just use that.

What pinion do we need to mount our NEO 550s to versa? We were looking through our current versa boxes and we don’t think we have it, but not 100%.

Rufus

posts.name: Abi
posts.cooked:
The coupler insert and key for the Neo 550 (or any 550 series motor) comes with the VersaPlanetary kits. However, if you are re-using and haven’t found one, you can purchase the hardware kit here , which will contain it. It’s the smallest one.

You will also need the 550 series mounting plate, which comes in this set

We used neo 550s and VP on our intake and conveyors last year, worked perfectly aside from some assembly issues in which the key was slightly too large to fit into the coupler and insert. We found a solution by grinding it down little by little until it fit.

posts.name: Brett B Bonner
posts.cooked:
Not quite what you asked, but in case you’re still considering alternatives, I’ll mention that NEO 550’s and Ultraplanetary make a nice pairing when size is important; the assembly is remarkably compact.

You can either buy individual components or buy one of the kits that includes an HD Hex motor, and ignore the motor (the kit is often a better deal depending on what you need, surprisingly).  In either case you may need the 1/2" hex output adapter for FRC applications.

posts.name: seg9585
posts.cooked: It wasn’t mentioned here, but many NEO 500 shafts are undersized and the couplers provided with the versaplanetary kits will slip right off. I resolved this by following instructions from REV to use green loctite, and it does an amazing job!

posts.name: Rufus Mainwaring
posts.cooked: You all provided great answers, thanks! Turns out we have a ton of these coupler packets, so we’ll start with that and use green loctite if needed. We have considered ultra, although for mounting in this case, the section with no shaft in between end of gearbox and start of 1/2 hex on the adapter was too long to be ideal. Again, thank you!
